00041 #include "gpm-idle.h"

00044 /* global in this file */
00045 cpudata     old;
00046 gboolean    init;
00047 double      loadpercentage;
00048 gint        time_idle_callback = 0;
00049 IdleCallback    callbackfunction;
00050 
00062 static gboolean
00063 cpudata_get_values (cpudata *data)
00064 {
00065     char tmp[5];
00066     char str[80];
00067     FILE *fd;
00068 
00069     /* assertion checks */
00070     g_assert (data);
00071 
00072     fd = fopen("/proc/stat", "r");
00073     if (!fd)
00074         return FALSE;
00075     fgets(str, 80, fd);
00076     sscanf(str, "%s %lu %lu %lu %lu", tmp, &data->user, &data->nice, &data->system, &data->idle);
00077     fclose(fd);
00078     /* 
00079      * Summing up all these times gives you the system uptime in jiffies.
00080      * This is what the uptime command does.
00081      */
00082     data->total = data->user + data->nice + data->system + data->idle;
00083     return TRUE;
00084 }
00085 
00092 static void
00093 cpudata_diff (cpudata *data2, cpudata *data1, cpudata *diff)
00094 {
00095     /* assertion checks */
00096     g_assert (data1);
00097     g_assert (data2);
00098     g_assert (diff);
00099 
00100     diff->user = data1->user - data2->user;
00101     diff->nice = data1->nice - data2->nice;
00102     diff->system = data1->system - data2->system;
00103     diff->idle = data1->idle - data2->idle;
00104     diff->total = data1->total - data2->total;
00105 }
00106 
00112 static void
00113 cpudata_copy (cpudata *to, cpudata *from)
00114 {
00115     /* assertion checks */
00116     g_assert (to);
00117     g_assert (from);
00118 
00119     to->user = from->user;
00120     to->nice = from->nice;
00121     to->system = from->system;
00122     to->idle = from->idle;
00123     to->total = from->total;
00124 }

00126 #if 0
00127 
00136 static void
00137 cpudata_normalize (cpudata *data)
00138 {
00139     /* assertion checks */
00140     g_assert (data);
00141 
00142     double factor = 100.0 / (double) data->total;
00143     data->user = (double) data->user * factor;
00144     data->nice = (double) data->nice * factor;
00145     data->system = (double) data->system * factor;
00146     data->idle = (double) data->idle * factor;
00147 }
00148 #endif
00149 
00154 static gint
00155 cpu_update_data (void)
00156 {
00157     cpudata new;
00158     cpudata diff;
00159 
00160     /* fill "old" value manually */
00161     if (!init) {
00162         init = TRUE;
00163         cpudata_get_values (&old);
00164         return 0;
00165     }
00166 
00167     /* work out the differences */
00168     cpudata_get_values (&new);
00169     cpudata_diff (&old, &new, &diff);
00170 
00171     /* Copy into old */
00172     cpudata_copy (&old, &new);
00173 
00174     /* If we divide the total time by idle time we get the load. */
00175     if (diff.idle > 0)
00176         loadpercentage = (double) diff.total / (double) diff.idle;
00177     else
00178         loadpercentage = 100;
00179     return loadpercentage;
00180 }
00181 
00188 gboolean
00189 gpm_idle_set_timeout (gint timeout)
00190 {
00191     if (timeout <= 0 || timeout > 10 * 60 * 60) {
00192         g_warning ("gpm_idle_set_timeout was called with value = %i", timeout);
00193         return FALSE;
00194     }
00195     g_debug ("gpm_idle_set_timeout = %i", timeout);
00196     time_idle_callback = timeout;
00197     return TRUE;
00198 }
00199 
00205 gboolean
00206 gpm_idle_set_callback (IdleCallback callback)
00207 {
00208     callbackfunction = callback;
00209     return TRUE;
00210 }
00211 
00221 gboolean
00222 gpm_idle_update (gpointer data)
00223 {
00224     gint gstime = 0;
00225     gint load;
00226 
00227     if (!callbackfunction) {
00228         g_warning ("gpm_idle_set_callback has not been called so no"
00229                "function set!");
00230         /* will stop polling */
00231         return FALSE;
00232     }
00233 
00234     if (time_idle_callback == 0) {
00235         g_debug ("gpm_idle_set_timeout has not been called with a valid "
00236              "timeout so no idle processing done");
00237         /*
00238          * Will not stop polling, as user could increase value by
00239          * changing g-conf value using g-p-p
00240          */
00241         return TRUE;
00242     }
00243 
00244     /* get our computed load value */
00245     load = cpu_update_data ();
00246 
00247     /* get idle time from g-s */
00248     if (!gscreensaver_get_idle (&gstime)) {
00249         g_warning ("getIdleTime polling disabled");
00250         return FALSE; /* will stop polling */
00251     }
00252     g_debug ("gpm_idle_update: gstime = %i, load = %i", gstime, load);
00253 
00254     /* check if "idle" enough */
00255     if (gstime > time_idle_callback && load < IDLE_LIMIT) {
00256         g_debug ("running callback function");
00257         callbackfunction (gstime);
00258     }
00259     return TRUE;
00260 }
